verb.description: Cease work or movement in order to relax, refresh oneself, or recover strength.
examples: he needed to rest after the feverish activity
I'm going to rest up before traveling to England

verb.description: Be placed or supported so as to stay in a specified position.
examples: her elbow was resting on the arm of the sofa

verb.description: Be based on or grounded in; depend on.
examples: the country's security rested on its alliances

verb.description: Conclude the case for the prosecution or the defense in a law case.

noun.description: An instance or period of relaxing or ceasing to engage in strenuous or stressful activity.
examples: you look as though you need a rest
a couple of days of complete rest

noun.description: An interval of silence of a specified duration.
An object that is used to support something.
